metadata.title: Cube Lessons - Learn the Rubik's Cube
metadata.description: Learn to solve the Rubik's Cube with step-by-step tutorials, from basic to advanced.
metadata.keywords: Rubik's Cube, Magic Cube, Cube, F2L, OLL, PLL, speedcubing, algorithms, move notation, tutorial, learning
metadata.ogTitle: Cube Lessons - Learn the Rubik's Cube
metadata.ogDescription: Learn to solve the Rubik's Cube with step-by-step tutorials, from basic to advanced.
metadata.ogImageAlt: Cube Lessons - Learn the Rubik's Cube
metadata.twitterTitle: Cube Lessons - Learn the Rubik's Cube
metadata.twitterDescription: Learn to solve the Rubik's Cube with step-by-step tutorials, from basic to advanced.

home.title: Learn the Rubik's Cube
home.description: Discover the secrets of the world's most famous puzzle. From basic to advanced, learn step-by-step methods to solve the Rubik's Cube with confidence.

f2l.title: First Two Layers (F2L)
f2l.description: Master the efficient method of solving the first two layers simultaneously, significantly reducing your solve time.

oll.title: Orientation of Last Layer (OLL)
oll.description: Learn the algorithms to orient all pieces of the last layer, creating a uniform top face.
oll.ariaLabel: Go to Orientation of Last Layer (OLL)

pll.title: Permutation of Last Layer (PLL)
pll.description: Complete your solve by learning how to permute the pieces of the last layer into their correct positions.
pll.ariaLabel: Go to Permutation of Last Layer (PLL)

cubePieces.title: Cube Pieces
cubePieces.description: Learn about all the pieces that make up the Rubik's Cube and understand how they move and interact with each other.

movements.title: Movements
movements.description: Learn the movement notation and how to execute them correctly to solve the cube efficiently.

timer.title: Timer
timer.description: Track your progress and improve your times with our timing and solve analysis system.

cubePieces.title: Cube Pieces
cubePieces.description: The Rubik's Cube has 3 types of pieces, each with unique characteristics and specific positions. Knowing these pieces is fundamental to understanding solution methods.

centers.name: Centers
centers.description: 6 fixed pieces that define the color of each face. They cannot be moved from their position.

edges.name: Edges
edges.description: 12 pieces with 2 colors. They can only be positioned between centers.

corners.name: Corners
corners.description: 8 pieces with 3 colors, located at the vertices of the cube.

movements.title: Movements
movements.description: To solve the Rubik's Cube we will use some formulas, which are sequences of movements that can be written (translated) with letters. It seems very complex, but it is extremely simple and intuitive. Each side of the cube is represented by its initial in English. If the letter is alone it means the movement is clockwise. If it is accompanied by an apostrophe, it means it is counterclockwise. And if it is followed by the number 2, it means it is a double movement.

M.name: M - Middle
M.description: Middle layer movement in the same direction as L

S.name: S - Middle
S.description: Middle layer movement in the same direction as F

X.name: X - Whole Cube
X.description: Whole cube movement in the same direction as R

Y.name: Y - Whole Cube
Y.description: Whole cube movement in the same direction as U

Z.name: Z - Whole Cube
Z.description: Whole cube movement in the same direction as F

firstTwoLayers.title: First Two Layers - F2L
firstTwoLayers.description: The F2L method, abbreviation for First Two Layers, focuses on completing the first two layers of the cube, representing two thirds of the total solution. At this stage, the approach differs from the basic method by prioritizing the simultaneous construction of corner and edge pairs.
firstTwoLayers.practiceDescription: Practice the 41 F2L cases to improve your recognition and execution speed.

orientationLastLayer.title: Orientation Last Layer - OLL
orientationLastLayer.description: OLL stands for Orientation of the Last Layer. At this stage the goal is to orient all pieces on the top face (usually yellow) so they face upward. After completing the first two layers, the top layer pieces will be in one of the 57 specific orientation cases.
orientationLastLayer.practiceDescription: Practice the 57 OLL cases to improve your recognition and execution speed.

permutationLastLayer.title: Permutation Last Layer - PLL
permutationLastLayer.description: PLL stands for Permutation of the Last Layer. At this stage, the goal is to solve all pieces in the last layer while maintaining their orientation. After completing OLL, the pieces will be in one of the 21 specific cases.
permutationLastLayer.practiceDescription: Practice the 21 PLL cases to improve your recognition and execution speed.

timer.title: Timer
timer.stopMobile: Tap the screen to stop the timer
timer.stopDesktop: Press space to stop the timer
timer.prepareMobile: Press and hold the screen for 1 second to prepare, release to start
timer.prepareDesktop: Hold space for 1 second to prepare, release to start
